instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speakers issue
threads.message:
Hello, I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with strage audio issue. 

The right speaker came I for replacement because of randomly loosing the tweet tones.  Replaced with new one and is better but still sounds distorted. 

I replaced <CHIP>U6550</CHIP> and is almost perfect but still has same distortion. 

Now after 1 minute of playing music both the speakers looses the tweet. What can it be?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speakers issue
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6450</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> are the tweeter amplifiers.
Check <CAPACITOR>C6450</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6500</CAPACITOR>.

Headphones sound is correct?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speakers issue
threads.message:
Headphones sound is correct? yes
<CAPACITOR>C6450</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6500</CAPACITOR> i repleced just in case, no differences. 

replaced <CHIP>U6500</CHIP> no differences. still audio goes lower after 20-30 seconds on both the speakers.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speakers issue
threads.message: Are you sure only tweeters are affected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speakers issue
threads.message:
no at this point. 
i am a bit lost. how can I check what is not working?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Speakers issue
